predictions.text: Japan Tokyo Core CPI (Ku-area, excluding fresh food, YoY) for November 2025 will print between 1.8% and 2.4%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm via Statistics Bureau of Japan preliminary Tokyo CPI release: Core CPI (all items less fresh food), YoY, November 2025. A result within 1.8%–2.4% counts as correct.
monitoring_signals: Energy and utility tariff changes in Tokyo
predictions.rationale: Base effects and subdued goods inflation offset by services resilience suggest a mid-2% handle risk but likely near low-2s.

predictions.text: Euro area (EA20) seasonally adjusted unemployment rate for October 2025 will print between 6.5% and 6.7%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm via Eurostat monthly release: euro area (EA20) unemployment rate, seasonally adjusted, October 2025. A result within 6.5%–6.7% counts as correct.
monitoring_signals: National unemployment prints (DE, FR, IT, ES)
predictions.rationale: Labor market remains tight but cooling gradually; recent prints clustered near 6.5–6.6%.

predictions.text: China NBS Non-Manufacturing PMI (headline) for November 2025 will print between 50.2 and 51.6.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm via National Bureau of Statistics of China official PMI release: Non-Manufacturing Business Activity Index, November 2025. A result within 50.2–51.6 counts as correct.
predictions.rationale: Services expansion persists but remains modest amid property drag; holiday and travel support keeps it above 50.

predictions.text: Canada GDP (monthly, MoM, seasonally adjusted) for September 2025 will print between -0.2% and +0.2%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm via Statistics Canada monthly GDP release: real GDP, seasonally adjusted, month-over-month change, September 2025. A result within -0.2% to +0.2% counts as correct.
monitoring_signals: Oil and gas output and maintenance outages
predictions.rationale: Mixed sectoral signals and energy volatility suggest a flat-to-small move month.

predictions.text: U.S. Nonfarm Payrolls (change, SA) for November 2025 will print between +130,000 and +230,000.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm via BLS Employment Situation: total nonfarm payroll employment monthly change, seasonally adjusted, November 2025. A result within +130k to +230k counts as correct.
predictions.rationale: Hiring decelerates but remains positive; claims steady and survey-based employment soft but not collapsing.

predictions.text: ISM Manufacturing Prices Index for November 2025 will print between 44.0 and 51.0.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm via ISM Manufacturing Report On Business: Prices Index, November 2025. A result within 44.0–51.0 counts as correct.
monitoring_signals: Regional Fed surveys (prices paid) e.g., Philly, Empire, Richmond
predictions.rationale: Goods disinflation and softer input demand keep prices sub-50 to low-50s.

predictions.text: U.S. Average Weekly Hours of All Employees (Total Private, SA) for November 2025 will print between 34.2 and 34.4 hours.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm via BLS Employment Situation: Average weekly hours of all employees, total private, seasonally adjusted, November 2025. A result within 34.2–34.4 hours counts as correct.
monitoring_signals: ISM manufacturing employment and hours commentary
Corporate guidance on staffing and overtime
predictions.rationale: Hours have stabilized around 34.3 as firms adjust margins via hours rather than headcount.

predictions.text: Google’s December 2025 Android Security Bulletin will include at least one CVE rated Critical with remote code execution impact.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm via Google Android Security Bulletin (December 2025): presence of at least one CVE explicitly marked severity Critical with RCE impact.
monitoring_signals: CISA KEV additions related to Android
predictions.rationale: Historical cadence: monthly bulletins frequently include at least one Critical RCE across media, framework, or system.

predictions.text: By 2025-12-31, OFAC will announce at least one Iran-related sanctions designation via an official U.S. Treasury press release.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm via U.S. Treasury website: an official press release announcing sanctions designations explicitly citing Iran-related authorities or targets by 2025-12-31.
predictions.rationale: Ongoing regional tensions and U.S. policy posture make additional Iran-related designations likely.

predictions.text: NASDAQ-100 Index (NDX) will close at a new all-time high on at least one trading day by 2025-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify via Nasdaq official close data: NDX closing level exceeds its prior record closing high on any trading day through 2025-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.rationale: AI-driven capex cycle and mega-cap momentum support new highs absent a rates shock.

predictions.text: ERCOT system load will exceed 65,000 MW in at least one hour between 2025-12-01 and 2025-12-31 (CST).
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm via ERCOT hourly load data: any hourly total system load > 65,000 MW during 2025-12-01 to 2025-12-31 CST counts as correct.
monitoring_signals: NWS temperature forecasts and HDDs for Texas load zones
Planned outages and renewable output forecasts
predictions.rationale: Seasonal cold snaps plus structural load growth (including data centers) raise odds of a >65 GW winter spike.

predictions.text: The Conference Board U.S. Consumer Confidence Index (headline) for December 2025 will print between 100.0 and 112.0.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm via The Conference Board release: headline Consumer Confidence Index, December 2025. A result within 100.0–112.0 counts as correct.
monitoring_signals: Labor market differential (jobs plentiful vs hard to get)
UMich preliminary sentiment as leading signal
predictions.rationale: Stable labor conditions and easing inflation support confidence near recent averages, capped by rate sensitivity.

predictions.text: ICE Brent front-month crude will settle at or above $86.00 per barrel on at least one trading day by 2025-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm via ICE settlement data: front-month Brent crude futures official daily settlement at or above $86.00/bbl on any trading day through 2025-12-31 (UTC).
monitoring_signals: OPEC+ policy decisions and quota compliance
OECD inventories and U.S. EIA weekly balances
predictions.rationale: OPEC+ management and geopolitical risks can lift Brent toward upper-$80s despite macro headwinds.
